Ad Text:
This opportunity sits within a global, highly reputable organisation with a strong brand, complex operations and real commercial scale.

This is a high-impact FP&A Manager role sitting at the centre of performance, planning and strategy. It’s forward-looking, highly visible, and suited to someone commercially sharp who can connect numbers to narrative.
You won’t have direct reports, but you will oversee and coordinate output from an offshore team. This is about influence, not hierarchy.

What you’ll be doing
Analyse trends and key drivers to clearly explain performance variances vs budget
Lead forecasting and reforecasting cycles with a forward-looking lens
Consolidate inputs from multiple commercial finance teams and identify performance gaps — then help shape how to close them
Deliver ad hoc analysis (e.g. digital vs traditional revenue streams) to support strategic decisions
Act as the SME between systems/data teams and finance — translating data into commercial insight
Build clear, executive-ready decks and presentation packs for senior stakeholders
What we’re looking for
4+ years’ experience in a commercial Finance Business Partnering role
Strong variance analysis and forecasting capability
Comfortable consolidating and challenging numbers across business units
Confident communicator who can present to senior stakeholders
Strong PowerPoint skills, you know how to tell a story, not just build slides
High calibre profile, second movers from Big 4/Mid-tier with proven commercial BP exposure are encouraged
This is not a back-office reporting role. It’s for someone who enjoys digging into performance drivers, asking “why?”, and influencing outcomes.
If you want exposure to a large, complex environment where digital transformation and commercial performance genuinely matter — this is worth a conversation.

Business Analyst - $155,000 pck - Flexible work arrangement - High profile organisation merger/transition and digital re-build

The company:

My client is one of Australia's most highly regarded organisations, which has become a house-hold name.

Offering its employees the flexibility to work from home, as well as an excellent salary and the ability to work with best in class products and technologies and a friendly and inclusive team environment, this is an employer of choice.

The role of the Business Analyst will include:

The project you will work on a range of projects including a large Transition/Merger project and Digital Re-build
Work in a fairly Agile environment
Work closely with the Project and Change Managers
Hold workshops, gather requirements, create documentation
Work with a large variety of stakeholders
To be successful in this role, you will need:

5+ years Business Analysis experience in reputable organisations 
Software procurement and/or implementation project experience is nice to have
Digital project experience
Agile experience 
Apply:
Apply with your CV in word format via the link provided, or contact Hollie Broekman of HireCloud - hollie@hirecloud.com.au with any queries.

Category:
Strategy & Planning (Consulting & Strategy)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Your key responsibilities:

Develop statewide and system service needs analyses, positions, plans, and planning products to inform future service, policy, governance, planning and purchasing/commissioning decisions for state-funded MHAOD services.
Undertake critical analysis of quantitative and qualitative data and information to identify future priorities and issues for strategic policy and service/system planning activities.
Utilise appropriate software (e.g., PowerBI, Excel, SQL, Tableau) for the extraction and analysis of large administrative data sets.

Role fit

The essential requirements for this role are:

Demonstrated experience in and ability to develop service and system planning analyses, advice and products in a large, complex service delivery organisation relevant to the MHAOD service system in Queensland.
Strong research, data analysis, critical analysis and problem-solving skills, including the ability to translate health literature, qualitative and quantitative data and information to develop relevant outputs and approaches, including system assessments, strategic or statewide service plans.
Demonstrated strong ability to manage complex system-wide and/or statewide projects that are time-critical and achieve expected deliverables relevant to MHAOD strategy and planning.

Why work with us? 

Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment that values people and prioritises employee success and wellbeing. This includes:

Competitive salaries

12.75% superannuation
17.5% leave loading

Employee wellbeing

38 hour full time work week
Access to 24/7 confidential employee support providers and counsellors including for immediate family members
Additional flexibility to support your work life balance including access to generous leave entitlements, such as purchased leave, domestic violence leave, reproductive health leave, cultural leave, study and examination leave.

Professional development

Career progression with more than 300 diverse career pathways and career support to take you further!
Access to a variety of programs and initiatives to support training and career growth.
Grow your skills through hands-on experience and access to internal training opportunities and additional financial and leave benefits for approved external training and development.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion 

At Queensland Health, our work environment is inclusive and supportive, and we value our employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of all cultures, abilities and backgrounds. 

Our commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity and inclusion means we understand some people may need changes to the recruitment process. If you need support during the recruitment process, such as meeting with the panel virtually instead of in person, please reach out to the hiring manager. We value diverse candidates and your need for adjustments will not affect our hiring decisions. 

Ready to apply?

For further information on how to apply please review the attached Role Description.

About AVS

At AVS, we don’t just work within science, we turn science into impact. As a key bridge between cutting-edge research and industry, we’re on a mission to unlock value from Victoria’s ag-tech innovations that deliver real economic, environmental, and societal benefits, turning discoveries into practical solutions that strengthen Victoria’s agricultural sector. AVS is a private company beneficially owned by the Victorian Government.

About the Role

We're seeking a Senior Investment Manager with advanced financial modelling, valuation, and economic analysis capability to assess early-stage investment opportunities and build business cases.

You will provide leadership for AVS's economic and impact analysis function and oversee the investment analyst supporting the investment pipeline.

You will:

Provide leadership, oversight and quality assurance for the investment analyst supporting financial and economic modelling
Lead the development of complex financial models (DCF, scenario/sensitivity, NPV, IRR)
Lead valuation analysis across licensing, spinouts, joint ventures and partnerships
Conduct economic impact assessments and market/economic modelling that informs strategic investment decisions
Develop robust business cases and investment recommendations
Work collaboratively with the Commercialisation Team to engage researchers, industry, and government stakeholders in validating and progressing opportunities.

About You

You bring:

Strong experience in venture investment, corporate finance, or innovation commercialisation
Deep financial and economic modelling skills
Experience providing analytical leadership or overseeing financial/economic analysis
Strong communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders
Tertiary qualifications in Finance, Economics, Commerce or related fields (MBA or ag-tech experience highly regarded)

Why join AVS?

Opportunity to directly influence major decisions shaping Victoria's agricultural innovation pipeline
A collaborative, values-driven culture that supports innovation and integrity
Hybrid flexible working arrangments
Work at the award-winning AgriBio Centre at La Trobe University's Bundoora campus
Contribute meaningful impact across Victoria's agricultural sector and broader innovation system

How to Apply

For additional details and selection criteria, please refer to the Position Description on https://jobs.careers.vic.gov.au/jobs/VG-1911644.

Submit your resume, a short cover letter, and a summary of how you meet the Key Selection Criteria in the position description (no more than 3 pages).

Applications close: 11.59pm on Sunday, 15 March 2026.

For a confidential conversation, email natasha.twigg@agriculture.vic.gov.au.

AVS values diversity and is committed to providing a safe and inclusive environment. We encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

Preferred candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening, including a Nationally Coordinated Criminal History Check.

Ready to drive investment in agricultural innovation?

Apply now and help shape the future of agriculture in Victoria and beyond.

Company: The Trustee for Cinc Performance Unit Trust
Ad Text:
Cinc. Performance Consulting partners with organisations to drive rapid performance uplift - optimising the delivery of strategy, product, and service. We specialise in operations excellence, process improvement, business transformation, and cost reduction across a wide range of industries. Our work often yields significant results: doubling output, reducing defects, and accelerating delivery.

We’re growing - and we’re looking for exceptional Senior Consultants or Managers to join our team in Sydney or Melbourne. This is a full-time role with some flexibility for remote work.


What you’ll do:

Lead and deliver performance improvement projects across diverse industries

Conduct rigorous analysis and develop solutions to solve complex operational and commercial problems

Apply lean methodologies and data analytics to drive measurable results

Build dashboards and models using Excel and Power BI (or similar platforms)

Engage with client teams and senior stakeholders to understand their operations and implement change

Mentor junior consultants and contribute to internal capability development


What we’re looking for:

Prior consulting experience (non-negotiable) - ideally from Big 4 (EY, KPMG, PwC, Deloitte) or tier-1 firms like Accenture

Strong background in operations excellence, process improvement, or transformation

Advanced Excel skills and experience with Power BI or similar data visualisation tools

Exposure to lean methodologies or a strong interest in lean thinking

Strong quantitative and analytical skills

Exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills

A genuine interest in working with a boutique firm where you’ll have real impact

Melbourne or Sydney location is required


Salary: $105,000 - $155,000 including Superannuation (commensurate with experience)


How to apply:

Submit your CV and a brief cover letter outlining your experience and interest in the role.

Check us out at cincperformance.com. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.

Launch Group are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to assist a client in the consulting space on an initial 4 month engagement as they pilot and scale Splunk IT Service Intelligence (ITSI) across the organisation.
  

Perth CBD location
Initial 4 month contract
Hybrid work arrangements
  
This role sits between business stakeholders, IT operations, and Splunk engineer - shaping service models, KPIs, and dashboards that improve service health, reduce incidents, and deliver real business value.
  
Key Responsibilities

Partner with business and service owners to understand critical services and monitoring needs
Run workshops and gather requirements, translating them into clear user stories and functional specs
Support ITSI service modelling, KPI definition, and data source identification
Assist with pilot planning, feedback analysis, and enterprise rollout activities
Align ITSI insights with ITSM processes (incident, problem, change) and help design improved workflows
Track adoption, usage, and value delivered through ITSI
  
Key Requirements

Strong experience as a Business Analyst in IT operations, ITSM, or similar environments
Experience with monitoring/observability platforms (Splunk, Dynatrace, AppDynamics, Datadog, etc.)
Strong understanding of ITIL and ITSM processes
Proven requirements gathering, documentation, and stakeholder engagement skills
Strong analytical capability and comfort working with dashboards and metrics
Excellent communication and facilitation skills
  
Nice to Have

Hands on Splunk or Splunk ITSI experience
Experience supporting enterprise tool rollouts
Familiarity with service modelling, event correlation, and KPI/SLI/SLO concepts
Exposure to Agile delivery and ServiceNow
Relevant certifications (ITIL, CBAP, Splunk)
  
For more information about this role, please apply today.

Company: MUFG Corporate Markets Service Co Pty
Ad Text:
A global, digitally enabled business that empowers a brighter future by connecting millions of people with their assets – safely, securely and responsibly. Through our two businesses MUFG Retirement Solutions and MUFG Corporate Markets, we partner with a diversified portfolio of global clients to provide robust, efficient and scalable services, purpose-built solutions and modern technology platforms that deliver world class outcomes and experiences. A member of MUFG, a global financial group, we help manage regulatory complexity, improve data management and connect people with their assets, through exceptional user experience that leverages the expertise of our people combined with scalable technology, digital connectivity and data insights.

Primary Location: Parramatta (with up to one day per week in Sydney CBD)

Hybrid model: 3 days in office / 2 days remote

We are seeking a senior, risk leader to design and lead our second-line oversight of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Data Privacy risk across a complex, APRA-regulated financial services environment.

This role carries significant accountability setting AI governance standards, defining risk appetite, leading model assurance processes, and embedding a robust data privacy framework aligned to global regulatory expectations.

You will operate at senior level, influencing strategic direction and enabling responsible innovation across the organisation.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic AI & Data Governance

Design and implement the enterprise-wide AI Policy and Data Risk Governance Model
Define AI/ML risk appetite and lifecycle controls (design, training, validation, deployment, monitoring)
Lead second-line oversight of AI Risk and Information Security Assessments
Drive continuous uplift of AI and data risk maturity
Provide executive-level advisory on emerging AI and regulatory risks

AI Risk & Model Oversight

Establish AI model validation, assurance and approval frameworks
Oversee model governance standards, documentation and control effectiveness
Ensure alignment with recognised frameworks (e.g., NIST AI RMF, ISO 42001)
Provide subject matter expertise on algorithmic bias, explainability, model drift and ethical AI use

Data Privacy & Regulatory Leadership

Lead enterprise data privacy framework, including policies, lineage and governance controls
Oversee Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) and privacy risk assessments
Ensure compliance with APRA CPS 234/230 and relevant global regulatory obligations
Manage privacy incident response, breach notification and regulator engagement
Oversee third-party data risk, cross-border transfers and vendor assurance

Enterprise Influence & People Leadership

Lead and develop a specialist team of AI Risk Managers and Data Privacy professionals
Influence Executive and Senior Leadership stakeholders on strategic risk priorities
Drive enterprise-wide capability uplift in AI and data risk culture
Partner across Technology, Cyber Security, Legal, Data Science and Business units

About You

This role requires a highly experienced risk professional with deep technical, regulatory and governance expertise.

Essential Experience

12+ years’ experience in Technology Risk, Information Security Risk, Data Risk or Model Risk
Demonstrated experience managing AI and Data Risk within a regulated financial services environment (investment banking or superannuation strongly preferred)
Proven leadership in designing and embedding enterprise-wide risk and compliance frameworks
Expertise across Technology, Data and Information Security risk domains
Strong understanding of APRA regulatory standards (including CPS 234 and CPS 230)
Working knowledge of global regulatory regimes such as EU DORA, UK FCA/PRA, SEBI and HKMA
Experience leading AI governance, model risk management or advanced analytics oversight
Program or transformation leadership across digital, data or AI initiatives
Experience engaging regulators and managing formal responses or reviews

Technical & Framework Expertise

Strong working knowledge of:

NIST Cybersecurity Framework and NIST AI Risk Management Framework
ISO 27001 and ISO 42001
COBIT, CIS Controls and PCI DSS
Enterprise data governance, privacy by design and secure SDLC practices
AI model lifecycle governance, validation and monitoring controls

Qualifications & Certifications

Graduate qualification required, tertiary or postgraduate qualifications in IT, Computer Science or Information Security desirable
Professional certifications such as CRISC, CISM, CISA, CISSP or ISO 27001 Lead Auditor preferred
Audit and/or consulting background advantageous

Personal Attributes

Strategic, commercially aware and outcome focused
Comfortable operating in complex, ambiguous environments
Strong executive presence with the ability to influence at senior levels
Passionate about responsible AI and the future of data-driven innovation
Proven people leader with strong team development capability
Highly organised with strong coordination and stakeholder management skills
Proficiency in MI and analytics tools such as Power BI, Tableau or Alteryx

If you are an experienced AI & Data Risk leader ready to operate at enterprise scale, we encourage you to apply.

Multinational retail group

Circa $300k - $400k + Super + Benefits

2 year contract

This leading multinational retail group operates in over 30 countries and is a true powerhouse, dominating their competitors and having an unmatched market share. Due to a combination of organic growth and strategic acquisitions, they have consistently experienced double digit growth and strong profitability. Consistently recognised as one of the top employers in Australia & NZ, they have developed an unbelievable culture that is employee focussed, supportive and engaging.

A fantastic opportunity has now arisen for a highly skilled and experienced Global Finance Transformation Lead to join their dynamic team. In this pivotal role, you will have a wide variety of responsibilities including:

Lead the design and implementation of finance transformation projects, ensuring alignment with the company's overall strategic objectives

Optimising processes, enhancing data analytics, and implementing cutting-edge technologies

Collaborate cross-functionally with various business units to understand their needs and develop integrated finance solutions

Automate and standardise month end reporting globally

Oversee the development and implementation of merchandise planning software (from a finance perspective)

Investment appraisal and planning challenge embedded ahead of major commitments, reducing the risk of misallocated capital

Identify and analyse opportunities for process improvements

Provide subject matter expertise and strategic guidance to the finance team and broader organisation on transformation initiatives

Key criteria you will have:

Extensive large scale transformation experience and a proven track record of leading successful finance transformation initiatives

Previous background within the retail or consumer products sectors

Strong project management and change management capabilities, with the ability to navigate organisational dynamics and drive cross-functional collaboration

Proficiency in financial analysis, reporting, and performance management, with a deep understanding of finance operations and systems

Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills

Relevant professional certifications (e.g., CA, CPA, CIMA) highly desirable

Interested?

To apply for this role, please email your resume to craig.durieu@lawsonelliott.com.au quoting reference CDR17455 or for additional information phone Craig Du Rieu CA on (02) 8274 0201.

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Contract Until End of September - Government Department
CBD Location - Hybrid Working Arrangement
Synthesise Data and Build Meaningful Reports

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-driven Reporting & Data Analyst to transform complex security data into clear, compelling executive insights to help the business make more informed decisions.

What you'll do

Design and deliver clear, concise executive and Board-level cyber security reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Consolidate and synthesise data from multiple security platforms into a centralised, trusted reporting view.
Build and maintain scalable ETL/ELT data pipelines to enable seamless movement of security data for analytics and reporting.
Develop an annual Security Report for Schools, translating technical metrics into a compelling narrative on trends, risks and performance.
Analyse security data to identify patterns, insights and actionable recommendations for senior stakeholders.

What you'll bring

Strong experience as a Reporting & Data Analyst
Strong experience in Power BI (dashboard design, data modelling, DAX, visual storytelling).
Experience designing and maintaining data pipelines and ETL/ELT processes.
Strong data modelling and data consolidation experience.
Ability to synthesise complex technical information into clear, non-technical insights.

What's in it for you:

Contract Until End of September
CBD Location - Hybrid work from home model
Government Agency

Please apply today to secure an interview or contact Sarah Jordan on sarah.jordan@talentinternational.com for more information.

Senior Data Scientist (Severe Care Reform)

Full time, fixed term role for 18 months
Geelong office location, with flexible hybrid working
Offering a competitive base salary of circa $155,000 plus super and benefits

 

Care in Action

With a career at the TAC, you’ll be helping us look out for the lives of everyone who travels on Victoria’s roads. That’s care in action.

Find out more about our shared purpose, and what drives every one of us.

Right now, we’re seeking a Senior Data Scientist (Severe Care Reform) who will play their part in this shared purpose, while also supporting the progress of clients and colleagues so they can achieve great things. That’s truly rewarding work that will help us continue to deliver life-critical services where it matters. 

 

About the role

The Senior Data Scientist leads high‑impact analytical work that informs how TAC improves outcomes for its most severely injured clients. Working closely with clinicians, researchers and operational teams, the role applies advanced data science techniques to generate insights, guide decision‑making and shape health strategy, policy and program design. It also helps build data science capability across the organisation, ensuring consistent, ethical and innovative analytical practice.

 

About the Team

This role will be a part of our Strategy and Research Branch, within the Performance, Risk and Strategy Division, which is responsible for driving strategic development and planning across the organisation.


Working closely with a small, fast-paced, and adaptable team, you will be joining a collaborative, friendly, and inclusive environment that is highly connected across the organisation and committed to delivering high-impact outcomes.


You will be supported by a Senior Manager who has a collaborative management style, working closely with the team to foster idea-sharing and involve everyone in problem-solving, while encouraging high levels of autonomy.

 

What we’re looking for

Advanced Data Science & Analytical Expertise

Deep capability in explorative and predictive analytics, data preparation, statistical modelling, data linkage, and applying modern techniques (e.g., simulation, process mining, unstructured data analysis) to generate meaningful insights in complex health and compensation contexts.

Collaborative Research & Stakeholder Engagement

The ability to work seamlessly with clinicians, researchers, economists, operational leaders and external partners to define research questions, co‑design analytical approaches and translate findings into practical, evidence‑based recommendations.

Strategic Insight & Communication

A strong ability to turn complex analytical outputs into clear, compelling insights for technical and non‑technical audiences, while shaping policy, program design and system improvement through evidence‑based thinking.

 

Why you’ll love it here

There’s more to work than a competitive salary and amazing employee benefits. As our newest Senior Data Scientist (SCR) you’ll also:

Make a positive difference

Every day the work you do at the TAC contributes to something bigger. As part of an inclusive, supportive team you’ll find real purpose in achieving goals, together.

Be rewarded for great work

We value our people, offering a service delivery payment, salary packaging and a reward and recognition program.

Grow and go places

We’re invested in your progress. When you work for one of Victoria’s largest and leading workplaces, you’ll receive extensive internal opportunities for development and access to the LinkedIn Learning Digital Hub.

 

Ready to put care in action? We’d like to hear from you.

Click apply to submit your Cover Letter and Resume. If successful, you’ll progress to a face-to-face interview. All applicants will be advised of the outcome of their application.

For more information, read the attached Position Description or contact Nicola McLennan at Nicola_mclennan@tac.vic.gov.au for a confidential discussion. Applications for this role will be accepted up until 11:55pm on Monday 16th of March.

If we can do anything to help make applying for this role easier, please let our People, Culture & Engagement Team know at recruitment@tac.vic.gov.au. If over the phone is better for you, our number is 03 9300 0501.

 

A safe place to work

We’re committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of employees. This extends to inclusion, diversity and accessibility in our employment practices, and encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, men, women and gender diverse people, culturally diverse, and LGBTIQA+ people to apply for roles.

 

Child Safety

At the TAC we are committed to the safety of children and young people. For more information regarding our commitment to child safety, please visit our website. 

 PD - Senior Data Science (Severe Care Reform).pdf

Are you a commercially minded Strategy & AI professional who loves building, not navigating layers of governance?

Want to apply AI in a fast-moving e-commerce environment where your ideas actually get implemented?

We’re partnering with a high-growth e-commerce business looking for a Strategy & AI Lead to shape and deliver their next phase of intelligent growth.

This is a rare opportunity to step away from heavily regulated banking environments and into a business that moves fast, experiments boldly, and values impact over process.

Daily your role will involve:

Develop and execute the company’s AI and data strategy aligned to commercial objectives.
Identify and implement AI use cases across customer experience, pricing, supply chain, marketing and operations.
Translate business problems into scalable AI / ML solutions.
Work closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing and Executive teams.
Drive automation, personalisation, forecasting and optimisation initiatives.
Build frameworks for responsible AI governance (without red tape overload).
You will operate as the bridge between strategy and execution — thinking commercially while ensuring delivery.
To succeed in this role, you will have:

Proven experience in Strategy, AI, Data Science or Advanced Analytics roles.
Experience delivering AI solutions in fast-paced environments (e-commerce, retail, tech, marketplaces ideal).
Strong commercial acumen, you understand margin, CAC, LTV and growth levers.
Ability to influence senior stakeholders and lead cross-functional initiatives.
Comfortable being both strategic and hands-on.
Background in banking highly regarded but this is your opportunity to move into something more dynamic.
In return, a package consisting of Base + Super and flexible office hours is on offer for the successful candidate.

Public transport consisting of Buses, Trains & Trams are a 5-minute walk away.

Please call Patrick Egan @ TalentWeb on 0407 261 441 for a Confidential Discussion or just hit the apply button below.

About The Role:

The Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Manager will lead financial planning and analysis for Whyalla Operations, acting as a leadership business partner to support sustainable commercial outcomes.

This role operates within a capital-intensive, commodity-driven environment, requiring strong financial insight to support decision-making across mining, steel manufacturing and ports operations




Employee Benefits:

Stability and job security – Be part of a business with over a century of steelmaking heritage, backed by State and Federal Government investment.

Work-life balance – A predictable shift roster lets you plan your life outside of work.

Community impact – Play your part in producing the steel that builds Australia’s railways, bridges, and infrastructure.




Key Responsibilities:

Insightful and timely analysis and reporting of monthly and forecast financial results.

Provide senior business leaders with decision making support.

Manage the preparation of financial forecasts, consolidated budgets, and the 5-year business plan, ensuring timely input and explanations from both accounting and operational teams.

Work with the business to ensure continual improvement to budgeting models and process.

Establish and oversee commercial opportunities and risks reporting process as part of annual budgeting process.

Mentor and develop FP&A analysts, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and data-driven decision-making support




About You:

Relevant tertiary qualification – commercial, finance, business management, etc.

Proven experience in a similar role

CPA/CIMA/CA or equivalent preferred.

Experience with leading and driving multi discipline integrated planning processes

Good understanding of key performance drivers in mining and steel production.

Financial modelling and Business Case preparation.

Ability to influence senior stakeholders and communicate complex financial concepts clearly.




About Us:

OneSteel Manufacturing operates a mining and steel manufacturing business. As Australia’s only manufacturer of special grade billet and steel long products we provide solutions for nation-building infrastructure including rail. With State and Federal Government investment, the South Australian Mining and Steel Manufacturing assets form part of the sovereign security of Australia’s manufacturing sector.




It is our ambition to cultivate an inclusive workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We encourage candidates from all cultural backgrounds, genders, orientations, age groups, and abilities to apply. Your diversity is our strength in creating sustainable and innovative steel solutions for Australia's tomorrow.




We are a 2026 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

About YOUR New Employer:

This energy organisation plays a crucial role in Australia’s clean energy future. They deliver complex energy solutions across the country to support the transition to cleaner, more sustainable energy. With an expanding strategic agenda, they are now seeking a Strategy Lead to help shape the company’s plan moving forward and lead high impact initiatives.

About YOUR New Role:

This role will report into the Strategy Director, and as the Strategy Lead, you will:

Contribute to the design and refinement of the company’s 10 year strategic roadmap
Build strong stakeholder engagement to secure alignment and drive execution of strategic priorities
Analyse internal data, market trends, competitor activity, and emerging risks to generate meaningful insights that inform strategic decisions.
Lead the end-to-end corporate strategic planning process across all business units
Develop and implement high-impact strategic initiatives that drive organisational performance
Track and report on key business KPIs and progress toward long-term strategic objectives
About YOU:

You have a strong background in strategy, gained through a top tier consulting firm (MBB or Tier 1) or an inhouse corporate strategy role. You’re comfortable working in fast paced environments and enjoy breaking down complex problems into clear, practical outcomes.
  
You’ll bring:

8-10 years’ experience in corporate strategy, strategic analysis, or strategy consulting, ideally gained within an MBB or Tier 1 consulting environment
Exposure to energy, infrastructure, utilities, or other capital-intensive industries is highly regarded
Strong problem solving and analytical skills, with experience working with large and complex data sets
Clear and structured communication skills, with the ability to turn analysis into practical recommendations
Experience in presenting to senior leaders and supporting executive and board level decisions
This rapidly expanding company offers a clear pathway for career growth and the support needed to help you achieve both your personal and the organisation’s objectives.
  
If the opportunity to play a key role in shaping the future success of this impressive business is of interest, hit the Apply Now button or contact Sefa Prasad (0483 945 772) or David Smith (0414 439 786).

Job Title: Senior Management Accountant | High Growth Fintech
Ad Text:
Senior Management Accountant - High-Growth Financial Services

Are you a commercially minded Senior Management Accountant looking for a role with real impact, broad exposure, and a seat at the table? This growing, fast-paced financial services business is expanding its footprint and is looking for a proactive finance professional to help drive performance across multiple regions.

This is a rare opportunity to join a lean, high-performing team where your analysis directly influences credit strategy, product profitability, treasury decisions, and overall business direction. If you enjoy variety, thrive in a dynamic environment, and want to step into a genuinely commercial role, this will suit you perfectly.

The Opportunity

Reporting to a senior finance leader, you'll play a pivotal role in budgeting, forecasting, cashflow management, FX exposure, portfolio analytics, and month-end performance. You'll partner closely with Product, Collections and Origination teams, influencing decisions from pricing to credit risk and portfolio yield.

This role offers:

End-to-end ownership across budgeting, forecasting and performance analysis
Direct involvement in strategic decision-making across credit, pricing, and product
Cross-regional exposure across multiple international markets
A blend of commercial analysis and core finance responsibilities
The chance to shape reporting automation and system improvements
Variety and visibility in a small, agile team - no "staying in your lane" here


Key Responsibilities

Budgeting & Forecasting

Lead monthly forecasting and annual budgets across revenue, impairment, costs and originations
Deliver insightful variance analysis and scenario modelling to senior stakeholders

Treasury, Cash Flow & FX

Manage short and long-term cashflow forecasting across multiple regions
Monitor liquidity, funding requirements and covenant compliance
Support FX exposure analysis and risk reporting

Month-End & Performance

Deliver commercial month-end insights and commentary
Analyse product and regional profitability
Prepare monthly accounts for external partners
Assist in annual financial statements preparation

Portfolio Analytics

Oversee impairment modelling and bad debt provisioning
Monitor delinquency and partner with Collections to improve outcomes
Assess credit risk impact on margin and yield

Product Yield & Commercial Analysis

Analyse product yield and customer-level profitability
Support pricing strategy and loan growth initiatives
Conduct cost-per-loan and lifetime value analysis

Systems & Process Improvement

Drive automation and enhanced reporting through Sage Intacct
Streamline dashboards, forecasting tools and cashflow models
Provide support across broader finance and financial control as needed

Dividends

Manage dividend policy, documentation and payment
Ensure tax efficiency, cashflow readiness, and covenant compliance

About You

CA/CPA qualified with a degree in Accounting, Finance or similar
Experience in financial services - ideally consumer lending or personal credit
Strong budgeting, forecasting and cashflow management capability
Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills
Experience with Sage Intacct (preferred) or similar cloud-based ERP
Commercially curious, analytical, and confident partnering with non-finance teams
Comfortable in a hands-on, fast-moving environment with broad responsibility

Why This Role?

If you're looking for a role where you can genuinely influence business performance - not just produce reports - this environment will give you that platform. You'll work closely with decision-makers, gain broad exposure across the business, and develop in both commercial and technical finance.

Apply Today

Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button.

Reference Number: (06800-0013390866)

This is a on-site position.

By clicking 'apply', you give your express consent that Robert Half may use your personal information to process your job application and to contact you from time to time for future employment opportunities. For further information on how Robert Half processes your personal information and how to access and correct your information, please read the Robert Half privacy notice: https://www.roberthalf.com/au/en/privacy. Please do not submit any sensitive personal data to us in your resume (such as government ID numbers, ethnicity, gender, religion, marital status or trade union membership) as we do not collect your sensitive personal data at this time.

About the Role:
We are seeking an experienced Finance Transformation Manager to lead an organisation’s finance transformation agenda. This role will focus on implementing a new ERP and planning/reporting solutions, improving finance processes, and optimising the end-to-end finance operating model.

You will be responsible for delivering large-scale finance change initiatives, driving adoption of new ways of working, and ensuring alignment with organisational objectives. The role requires strong leadership, stakeholder management, and project governance skills, as well as a deep understanding of finance operations.


Key Responsibilities
Lead end-to-end finance transformation initiatives, including process improvement, planning, and reporting.
Drive user acceptance testing, training, cutover planning, data validation, and post-go-live optimisation.
Develop and execute change management plans to ensure business readiness and adoption.
Build strong relationships across executive and operational teams to influence and support transformation initiatives.
Establish and lead project governance forums, managing timelines, risks, budgets, and interdependencies.
Key Skills & Experience
Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Commerce or related discipline.
Professional accounting qualification (CPA, CA, CIMA or ACCA) highly regarded.
Proven experience delivering large-scale finance transformation programs.
Strong understanding of FP&A, Accounting, and Procurement processes.
Ability to lead cross-functional teams and influence senior stakeholders.
Experience managing complex change initiatives in dynamic environments.
Strong project management skills; certifications (e.g., PRINCE2, Agile) advantageous.
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and workshop facilitation skills.
This is a fantastic opportunity for a finance professional with a strong track record in transformation and change leadership to make a meaningful impact across the organisation.

Analyse investment opportunities and strategic initiatives
Build and maintain enterprise financial models
Attractive hybrid work model | Energy Discounts |Career Growth Opportunities

Alinta Energy is one of Australia’s biggest energy retailers, generators and developers with over 1.1 million customers. Australia’s energy system is undergoing the biggest transformation in its history and we’re right there with it. We’re investing in and developing large-scale renewables and storage projects as part of our ongoing effort to provide our customers with reliable, affordable and sustainable energy.

We understand that flexibility matters when considering your next role. Let us know your requirements, and we’ll carefully consider how we might accommodate them.

Ready to make a real impact?

This role sits at the centre of Alinta Energy’s strategic decision‑making, supporting the Corporate Strategy team during a period of growth, integration and transformation. It is not a traditional accounting or reporting role - instead, it’s designed for someone with 3-5+ years’ experience who enjoys strategic analysis, commercial thinking and contributing to enterprise‑wide decisions.

You’ll work across a broad and changing set of priorities, including assessing investment opportunities, supporting capital allocation decisions and contributing to long‑term planning. A key part of the role involves using and maintaining the corporate model and five‑year business plan to test scenarios, evaluate options and support executive decision‑making, while coordinating inputs from stakeholders across the business.

With regular exposure to senior leaders and visibility across Retail, Merchant Energy, Power Generation and Finance, this role is ideal for someone early‑to‑mid career from a corporate strategy, consulting or commercial analysis background. It offers the opportunity to build a strong enterprise‑wide understanding of the business and develop skills that open pathways into other strategic roles over time.

Why you’ll love working here

At Alinta Energy, we’re taking real action to deliver reliable and sustainable energy for Australia - and that practical approach runs through everything we do. You’ll get clear direction, genuine flexibility, and the support you need to grow, all while working on projects that make a lasting difference. We’re big enough to create impact, but small enough that your ideas and effort will always be seen.

There are plenty of other great benefits of working for Alinta Energy, including flexible working, energy discounts, an Employee Assistance Program (EAP), a paid volunteer day each year, fully stocked kitchens, and lots more.

What you’ll do

Assess investment opportunities and capital allocation options aligned to business strategy
Maintain and use the corporate model and five‑year business plan to test strategic scenarios
Undertake scenario, portfolio and competitor analysis to inform executive decision‑making
Support enterprise‑wide strategic initiatives through commercial analysis and stakeholder coordination
Prepare strategy, investment and executive presentations for the CFO and senior leadership team

Your experience

3-5+ years’ experience in corporate strategy, consulting, transaction advisory or commercial analysis
Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline such as finance, economics, commerce or strategy
Strong understanding of corporate finance and financial evaluation, rather than statutory reporting
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills, with the ability to synthesise analysis into executive‑level insights
Proven experience coordinating complex, cross‑functional work and engaging confidently with senior stakeholders

Please note this role requires full working rights within Australia.

This role is best suited to a commercially minded individual who thrives in a fast‑moving, complex environment and enjoys applying analysis to strategic decision‑making.

Like what you’re seeing?

If you like the sound of this, and you’ve got experience in a similar role, we’d love to talk to you. Come and discover better together with Alinta Energy.

We are a 2026 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

If your application progresses, we will need to complete background and pre-employment checks, such as immigration checks, reference checks, criminal background checks, qualification checks, and additional checks for roles related to finance.

Our Diversity Commitment

Alinta Energy offers a truly diverse, safe and supportive work environment. As an equal opportunity employer, Alinta Energy encourages applications from any qualified person, including First Nations Australians, members of the LGBTQIA+ community, people of all ages and people living with a disability. We are also proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer and we are committed to advancing women’s careers.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Click ‘Apply’ to submit your application.
Closing date: Sunday 15th March

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Talent International, a leading Australian recruitment firm, have been engaged by our long standing client, a well-established professional services organisation undergoing significant growth and data modernisation.



We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer to play a key role in transforming and modernising their enterprise data capability.



Role Title: Senior Data Engineer

Location + WFH Flexibility: Parramatta - Fully Onsite

Salary: $150,000 - $170,000 + Super

Project: Modernising enterprise data processing capability and building scalable ELT data warehouse solutions

Client Industry: Professional Services (Financial Services focused)



Role Details:


Lead the design and build of enterprise-grade ELT pipelines using DBT, Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks

Develop and optimise scalable data warehouse solutions, focusing on transformation and data quality

Implement and maintain CI/CD workflows within transaction-heavy enterprise environments

Deliver end-to-end backend reporting solutions from source systems through to data warehouse

Support ongoing data warehouse build, ensuring strong governance, documentation and operational stability



Required Skills and Experience:

5+ years' experience in Data Engineering within enterprise environments

Strong hands-on expertise in DBT, Azure Databricks and CI/CD workflows (non-negotiable)

Experience working with large-scale, transaction-heavy systems

Advanced SQL and Python capability

Experience within the finance sector or mid-sized organisations highly regarded



What Success Looks Like (First 3-6 Months):

Continued build and optimisation of the data warehouse ELT framework

Focused transformation layer development with strong data quality controls

Delivery of all current backend reporting requirements end-to-end

Power BI reporting capability (nice to have)



Ideal Candidate Profile:

This role suits a technically strong engineer who thrives in fast-paced, complex environments. We are seeking someone who demonstrates:

Operational agility and adaptability to changing priorities

Professional steadiness under pressure

Strong ownership mindset and delivery focus

This role will not suit individuals who become easily overwhelmed, struggle with ambiguity, or lack resilience in dynamic enterprise settings.



Additional Details & Benefits:

Senior-level position with strong influence on data strategy

Growth-driven replacement hire as part of broader organisational expansion

High-impact role within a modernising data function

Stable and growing professional services organisation



To Apply:

If this sounds like your next opportunity or you would like to hear more, please 'apply now' and submit your resume.

About Your New Employer
  
West Technology is currently partnering with an Australian group that has grown to become a defined market leader in multiple industry sectors.
This business is currently undertaking a large transformation program that will set a platform for this business to continue to scale and grow.
  
  
Your New Role
  
This newly created role will join a stable and high performing IT team under the leadership of a highly accomplished CIO.
Working as an integral part of the transformation program including a multi-year initiative to implement Infor LN (ERP system) across the group.
The Senior ERP Consultant is highly visible within the technology team and will be the subject specialist for the Infor LN platform for the group.
This critical role will be the conduit between finance, technology and the PMO functions.
  
Key Responsibilities:

Act as the subject expert for Infor LN, including implementation, upgrades & enhancements
Partner with Finance stakeholders across to identify business needs and future-state requirements.
Translate Finance requirements into functional system specifications including workflows and integration.
Apply best practice thinking to system and process design, challenging legacy practices and unnecessary customisation.
Engage with Finance teams, the PMO and external vendors to ensure the effective delivery.
Represent the IT function by leading design workshops, architecture discussions and solution walk-throughs.
 
About You!

You will hold a degree or formal IT qualification.
You come from a dedicated role supporting ERP solutions, ideally Infor LN or comparable systems such as Netsuite, SAP or Oracle.  
You have tangible experience supporting a finance transformation that involve ERP implementations or major upgrades.
You demonstrate sound knowledge of finance modules and the role they play in the ERP (AP, AR, GL, Fixed Assets).
You’re familiar with finance automation, planning & reconciliation tools.
Interpersonally, you are a strong communicator who instils confidence in your stakeholders and values organisation and innovative thinking.
  
Sound interesting? Apply below or call Dean Mumford on 0450 901 035 if you would like to discuss this in detail.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - Resilience and Crisis Management (Payments)
Ad Text:
Senior Business Analyst - Resilience and Crisis Management (Payments)

 

$150k - $155k + super + 10% bonus
Sydney CBD / Hybrid
Permanent Position

 

Please tailor your resume to the below job advert before applying. Candidates without Resilience and Crisis Management experience will NOT be considered.

 

About the role:

This is a newly created Senior Business Analyst opportunity within a dedicated Industry Resilience and Crisis Management function. Recently elevated to a standalone team due to its strategic importance, this function provides leadership across industry level severe incident and crisis management, resilience planning, industry wide scenario testing and development of insights to strengthen payments system resilience across Australia.

Sitting in a highly consultative and visible environment, this role supports the uplift of industry capability to plan for, respond to and recover from significant payments incidents. You will work closely with internal stakeholders, members, regulators and government bodies to ensure alignment with evolving resilience expectations.

While strong frameworks and response plans are already in place, the focus of this role is on continuous improvement, strengthening governance and enhancing industry coordination rather than building from scratch.

 

Key responsibilities:

Day to day management and continuous improvement of continuity, incident and crisis management plans
Acting as a primary or secondary point of contact for key resilience frameworks and playbooks
Coordinating industry wide rapid response activities during significant payment incidents
Conducting post incident reviews, deep dive analysis and driving uplift initiatives
Designing and running industry wide scenario testing and resilience exercises
Monitoring emerging threats including cyber, operational and geopolitical risks
Supporting development of industry insights, whitepapers and resilience reporting
Working closely with regulators and government bodies to align with resilience expectations
Facilitating collaboration across banks and payment service providers
Preparing updates for senior stakeholders, executive leadership and board level forums

 

Required Experience:

5+ years’ experience in resilience, incident, crisis or business continuity management
Strong SME level hands on experience across incident response and crisis frameworks
Financial services experience, ideally within banking or payments
Exposure to industry level or enterprise wide scenario simulation exercises
Strong research, analytical and post incident review capability
Confident stakeholder engagement skills, including working with senior executives and regulators
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Detailed understanding of payment flows and processes (desirable)
Experience working with financial services regulatory bodies (desirable)
Exposure to project and or program management environments (desirable)

 

This is a high impact role offering strong autonomy, executive visibility and the opportunity to strengthen resilience across Australia’s payments ecosystem in a dynamic, fast paced and purpose driven environment.

Job Title: Senior Group FP&A Analyst - open to corporate finance and TS first movers
Ad Text:
Hybrid working, supportive culture, WFH flexibility
$140-160K + super + bonus on offer
Requires strong excel, modelling and presentation capabilities
Reporting into the Group FP&A Manager of this ASX200, this Senior Analyst role presents a compelling opportunity to join an Australian institution.

You'll play a crucial role in the delivery of budgeting, forecasting, strategic planning, board reporting and consolidated management reporting for the group.

You'll partner with a variety of senior stakeholders across the Corporate entity, in the delivery of insights and decision support, as well as ad hoc analysis and reporting when required. Whilst you'll also be involved in ongoing continuous improvement projects.

You are CA or CPA qualified, with a background working as an Analyst or Senior Analyst, within a group-level F&A function of a complex, ASX-listed Blue Chip corporate.

You'll have advanced Excel skills, financial modelling capability and proven business partnering capability. You'll also be ambitious and looking to move towards a leadership role in future.

For more information contact Schenuk Wijesekera on 02 9775 5916 or apply using the apply button.
